content: I am new here and new to Zulip. I successfully installed a server. I would like to use Mail-in-a-box as my email server, because I already got one up and running for my organisation. But the noreply@abc.com is giving me some headaches. I am getting this error: Sender address rejected: not owned by user zulip@abc.com But I do not know how I can set this up. The main zulip@abc.com is no problem, the issue is with the "noreply@" I already asked in the MIAB support forum, but maybe there is someone here who has successfully used MIAB with Zulip?

@Max Baum Itâ€™s entirely up to Mail-in-a-box whether it lets you send mail as noreply@abc.com when logged in as zulip@abc.com. Based on the documentation, you may be able to change this in Mail-in-a-box by creating a mail-forward alias for noreply that includes the zulip user in its permitted senders field. Or you can change NOREPLY_EMAIL_ADDRESS to match EMAIL_HOST_USER in the Zulip configuration.

Thank you!

I guess, I was hoping, someone had already done it and could share their settings. :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:

I found a way now, although it feels a bit "hacky" by having two email users and each is an alias of the other and can send as the other.
